definition: to deposit (e.g. in a bank account)
to exist/to deposit/to store/to keep/to survive
to enter/to go into/to join/to become a member of/to confirm or agree with/abbr. for 入聲|入声[ru4 sheng1]

sentences.english: A foreign party is encouraged to deposit in the Bank of China any part of foreign exchange which he is entitled to remit abroad.
sentences.chinese: 鼓勵外國合營者將可匯出的外匯存入中國銀行。

sentences.english: It is safest to deposit your money in the bank.
All applications will be placed in our Talent Pool and handled with strictest confidence, non-returnable.
sentences.chinese: 所有簡歷均會存入集團人才庫，保密處理，恕不退還。

sentences.english: I payed $500 into the bank every month.
sentences.chinese: 我每月把500美元存入銀行。

sentences.english: I think you may deposit your money with the bank or leave it here for temporary safe-keeping .
sentences.chinese: 我以爲你可把錢存入銀行，或留在銀行暫保管起來。

sentences.english: By the subtitle decoder, the subtitles will be held in SDRAM in the receiver.
sentences.chinese: 經由字幕解碼器，字幕可以被存入片外SDRAM。

sentences.english: The shutouts will soon be sent to the warehouse.
sentences.chinese: 退關貨物很快被存入倉庫。

sentences.english: I bank five yuan every month.
sentences.chinese: 我每月存入銀行五元錢。

sentences.english: NO05,6. Please endorse the back of this check before you deposit it.
sentences.chinese: 存入這張支票前，請在後面背書。

sentences.english: One of the coolest things about 4Food is the ability to save the burgers you’ve made to the food system.
sentences.chinese: 它最酷的功能之一是把你個人配製的漢堡存入系統。

sentences.english: With regards to transactions in CFDs, Clients are required to deposit a Margin with the Company in order to open a position.
sentences.chinese: 在交易差價合約時，客戶需要存入保證金才能開倉。

sentences.english: Once the data is in the database, the process is complete.
sentences.chinese: 數據一旦存入數據庫，處理過程就完成了。

sentences.english: As a result, the transferred money will be deposited into the attacker's account.
sentences.chinese: 其結果是，轉帳的金額將被存入攻擊者的帳戶中。

sentences.english: Any person or organization that keeps money in a band is a depositor.
sentences.chinese: 把錢存入銀行的任何個人或組識都叫存戶。

sentences.english: I have always banked my money with the saving bank.
sentences.chinese: 我總是把錢存入儲蓄銀行。

sentences.english: File your writing in your portfolio.

definition: to deposit/to store/to leave in sb's care
to withdraw money/to take money out of the bank
to transfer (money to a bank account)
restitution/return of something to its original owner/remittance
